result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew Michael Scanlon

records.addlTxt:
3:26 PM Defendant Matthew Michael Scanlon in court.  Attorney Angela Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Defendant does not have attorney, denied for public defender, needs to apply for court appointed attorney. Court indicates would not qualify for court appointed attorney. Defendant not ready for preliminary hearing on Wednesday. Court questions when will he get attorney. Defendant indicates needs time to come up with money for attorney. Court sets date. Defendant signs notice. Defendant reminded of bond conditions.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:28 PM Defendant Matthew Michael Scanlon appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Michael Hoffman making a special appearance via zoom.  Attorney Peter Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Attorney requests preliminary hearing. Not guilty plea(s) entered. 
State rqsts 2500cb with conditions of No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Felony charges with Duluth address, currently on probation; unsure if there will be a hold.  History of failures to appear x3, convictions are almost entirely out of MN. multiple Probation violations.  WI cases with 2 fta's
Attorney Hoffman st louis county resident entire life, family ties, employed in Duluth. Unable to post a significant amount of cash.  
Defendant indicates he has $180 on him.
Court reviews requests and cites concerns; Orders $2500 cash bail with conditions of No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Court questions defendants intent re: counsel-Attorney Hoffman indicated he did not qualify.  Court explains option to waive time limits for preliminary hearing.
Defendant requests more time to obtain an attorney.
Court accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing as knowing and voluntary.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
